sentences.text: (*) Non-GAAP Financial Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-GAAP adjusted measures should be viewed in addition to, and not as an alternative for, financial results prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Exhibit C to this proxy statement for more information about these non-GAAP financial measures and for a reconciliation of these non-GAAP measures to the most comparable GAAP measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our business results, the Compensation Committee took the following actions with respect to the 2016 compensation of the Named Executive Officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Incentive Program (the CIP), our annual performance-based cash incentive program, for our Named Executive Officers was funded at 113.6% and paid out in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CIP was funded based on a pre-established adjusted operating income goal and strategic Company performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the section entitled Annual Performance- Based Cash Bonuses below for a detailed discussion of the CIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries were increased between 3% and 9% for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These base salary increases took into consideration the competitive market for executive talent, Company performance and the other factors described in the section entitled Executive Compensation Elements below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee granted equity awards in the form of options to purchase shares of our common stock and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The size of each grant was based on several factors including managing the Companys burn rate, reducing our equity overhang in the long run, maintaining our ability to compete for outstanding talent, and maintaining our corporate compensation philosophies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Results of Stockholder Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, we conducted a stockholder advisory vote on the 2015 compensation of our then Named Executive Officers (commonly known as a Say-on-Pay vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders approved the 2015 compensation of our-then Named Executive Officers, with approximately 97% of the votes cast voted in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee took the results of this Say-on-Pay vote into consideration when making compensation decisions following the 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the outcome of the Say-on-Pay vote reflects our stockholders support of our compensation approach, specifically our efforts to attract, retain, and motivate our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, no significant design changes were made to the executive compensation program due to the 2015 Say-on-Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, any design changes resulting from the Say-on-Pay vote would not typically affect compensation until the following fiscal year due to the timing of our Annual Meeting of Stockholders relative to the Compensation Committee meeting at which compensation decisions are made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value the opinions of our stockholders and will continue to consider the outcome of future Say-on-Pay votes, as well as feedback received throughout the year, when making compensation decisions for our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the results of a separate stockholder advisory vote on the frequency of future stockholder advisory votes regarding the compensation of our Named Executive Officers conducted at our 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, our Board determined that we will hold Say-on-Pay votes on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by Section 14A of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, we are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: conducting a Say-on-Frequency vote at the Annual Meeting to which this Proxy Statement relates to solicit the vote of our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stockholders on the frequency with which we will hold future stockholder advisory votes on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Proposal No. 3 below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation program is closely aligned with stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While base salary and an annual performance-based cash bonus opportunity incentivize the achievement of shorter-term goals, our long-term equity awards in the form of options to purchase shares of our common stock, which are typically subject to either a 4-year or 3.5-year vesting requirement and a 10-year term, and RSUs that are settled in shares of our common stock, which are typically subject to a 4-year vesting requirement, represent a longer-term compensation structure that promotes retention and continuous commitment to the operating results of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We further believe this compensation mix rewards each executive officer for their individual contributions to the Company, both present and future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this phase in our growth cycle, a majority of the annual direct compensation of our executive officers is directly tied, through the use of stock options and RSUs, to the growth in the value of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To illustrate this point, the following chart displays the historical relationship between the annual total direct compensation of our Chief Executive Officer, and the changes in stockholder value as reflected by the percentage change in value of the market price of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For illustration purposes, our Chief Executive Officer's annual total direct compensation consists of base salary paid, bonus earned, and the grant date fair value of his long-term equity awards (including stock options and RSUs) granted in the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart assumes a like number of stock options to the February 15, 2017 grant will be granted on August 15, 2017 using the same Black-Scholes fair value as of February 15, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock return is calculated based on the closing market price of our common stock on the date of the fiscal year end.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock return is indexed to 2012 such that it represents the stock price percentage change over the 2012 fiscal year end price of $490.37, and our Chief Executive Officers annual total direct compensation is similarly indexed to his 2012 annual total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We endeavor to maintain sound governance standards consistent with our executive compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates our executive compensation program on an ongoing basis to ensure that it is consistent with our short-term and long-term goals given the dynamic nature of our business and the market in which we compete for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following policies and practices were in effect during 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is comprised solely of independent directors who we believe have established effective means for communicating with stockholders regarding their executive compensation ideas and concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Committee Adviser.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee engaged its own independent compensation consultant to assist with its 2016 compensation review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, other than its work for our Compensation Committee, this consultant performed no consulting or other services for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Biennial Executive Compensation Review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee conducts a biennial review and approval of our compensation strategy, including a review of our compensation peer group used for comparative purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Policies and Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy and related corporate governance policies and practices are complemented by several specific compensation practices that are designed to align our executive compensation with long-term stockholder interests, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Employment Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have employment agreements with any of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All executive officers are employed at will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation At-Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed so a significant portion of compensation is at risk based on corporate performance, including equity-based compensation, to align the interests of our executive officers and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Executive Retirement Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, we do not offer, nor do we have plans to provide, pension arrangements, retirement plans, or nonqualified deferred compensation plans or arrangements to our executive officers that are not otherwise available on the same basis to our other full-time employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Executive Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide any perquisites or other personal benefits to our executive officers that are not otherwise available on the same basis to our other full-time employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Reimbursements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide any tax reimbursement payments (including gross-ups) on any element of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Special Health or Welfare Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers participate in broad-based company-sponsored health and welfare benefits programs on the same basis as our other full-time, salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Change-in-Control Arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All change-in-control payments and benefits pursuant to the Company-wide change in control plan are based on a double-trigger arrangement (that is, they require both a change- in-control of the Company plus a qualifying termination of employment before payments and benefits are paid).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain stock ownership guidelines for our executive officers and members of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Plan Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Repricing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Companys equity plans expressly forbid option repricing without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Buyout of Underwater Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Company's active equity plans also expressly prohibit the Company from buying out stock options whose exercise price exceeds the fair market value of our common stock, often referred to as underwater options, for cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Liberal Recycling of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Company's active equity plans prohibit the liberal recycling of shares or underlying awards made under plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the number of shares reserved for issuance under the plans is an accurate reflection of the size of the awards we actually issue and is not inflated by the add back of any portion of the awards that may be withheld to pay exercise prices or taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Automatic Single Trigger Vesting of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the Companys active equity plans provide for automatic acceleration of equity awards upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging and Pledging Prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit our employees and members of our Board of Directors from hedging or pledging any Company securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review the risks associated with key executive officer positions and endeavor to ensure adequate succession plans are in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goal of Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary objective of our executive compensation program is to attract and retain a talented, entrepreneurial, and creative team of executives who will provide leadership to make surgery more effective, less invasive, and easier on surgeons, patients, and their families.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to accomplish this goal in a way that is aligned with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We employ a team-based approach to compensating our executive officers, which is predicated on two principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive officer must demonstrate exceptional individual performance to remain a part of our executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that executive officers who underperform should be removed from our executive team and have their compensation adjusted accordingly, or be dismissed from the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive officer must contribute as a member of the team to our overall success rather than merely achieve specific objectives within his or her area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this team-based approach, the Compensation Committee carefully considers the relative compensation levels among all members of the executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our executive compensation program is designed to be internally consistent and equitable to further the Companys success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As reflected in the discussion below, the differences in the amounts awarded to each of our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, relate primarily to the experience, responsibilities, and performance of each individual executive officer, and differing market practices for compensation in each executive officers function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Mix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, we relied on long-term equity awards in the form of options to purchase shares of our common stock to attract, motivate, and retain an outstanding management team and to ensure a strong connection between our executive compensation program and the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe stock options are an effective compensation element for attracting entrepreneurial, creative executive officers that rewards stockholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is because our executive officers realize value from their stock options only when the market price of our common stock increases over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By ensuring that our executive officers have a significant portion of their potential compensation tied to long-term stock price performance, we are able to closely align the interest of our executive officers with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2014, we added RSUs to our long-term equity award portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that a mix of stock options and RSUs enable us to effectively compete for talent in the marketplace while continuing to align the interests of our executive team to the interests of our stockholders and reducing our equity burn rate and overhang.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We weigh the target total direct compensation opportunities of our executive officers more towards long-term equity awards rather cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the value of long-term equity awards for the Named Executive Officers represented the majority of their total direct compensation opportunities, as illustrated by the following charts:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total cash compensation opportunity of our Chief Executive Officer for 2016 represented approximately 34% of his total direct compensation opportunity (the sum of total cash compensation earned and long-term equity awards) in 2016, as reflected in the Summary Compensation Table, while his total equity compensation opportunity represented approximately 66% of his total direct compensation opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons explained above, we place less emphasis on total cash compensation opportunity (the sum of base salary and annual performance-based cash bonuses) than on long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the total cash compensation opportunity of our other Named Executive Officers, excluding our Chief Executive Officer, for 2016 represented approximately 31% of their total direct compensation opportunity (the sum of total cash compensation earned and the grant date fair value of long-term equity awards) in 2016, as reflected in the Summary Compensation Table, while their total equity compensation opportunity represented approximately 69% of their total direct compensation opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees our executive compensation program (including our executive compensation policies and practices), approves the compensation of our executive officers, and administers our various stock compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Compensation Committee is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an independent director under the requirements of The NASDAQ Stock Market,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) an outside director as defined in Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (the Code), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a non-employee director within the meaning of Exchange Act Rule 16b-3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has adopted a written charter approved by our Board of Directors, which is available on our website at www.intuitivesurgical.com/company/governance.html.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves the compensation of our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers (other than Dr. Guthart), based on its evaluation of their individual performance, as well as Dr. Gutharts recommendations related to the executive officers who report to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Compensation Committees request, Dr. Guthart reviews with the Compensation Committee the performance of each of the other executive officers, including each of our other Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee gives considerable weight to Dr. Gutharts evaluations of the other executive officers because of his direct knowledge of each executive officers performance and contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, after considering the recommendations of Dr. Guthart as well as the factors noted below, then determines whether the recommended changes in each executive officers compensation, if any, are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee reviews the performance of Dr. Guthart to determine whether to make any changes in his
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following its approval of any changes to his compensation, the Compensation Committee presents such changes to the independent members of our Board of Directors for review and ratification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee receives support from our Human Resources Department in designing our executive compensation program and analyzing competitive market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Dr. Guthart participates in Compensation Committee meetings, providing input from our executive team on organizational structure, executive development, and financial analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above, Dr. Guthart also provides recommendations (except with respect to his own compensation) to the Compensation Committee regarding cash and equity compensation for our executive officers and how to use incentive compensation to further our growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are not present when their specific compensation arrangements are discussed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee directly retained the services of Compensia, Inc. (Compensia), a national executive compensation consulting firm, to assist it in fulfilling its duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensia does not provide any services to the Company other than the services provided to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has assessed the independence of Compensia taking into account, among other things, the factors set forth in Exchange Act Rule 10C-1 and the listing standards of the NASDAQ Stock Market, and has concluded that no conflict of interest exists with respect to the work that Compensia performs for the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Positioning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee does not establish compensation levels based solely on a review of competitive market data, it believes that such data is a useful tool in its deliberations as it recognizes that our compensation policies and practices must be competitive in the marketplace for us to be able to attract, motivate, and retain qualified executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the Compensation Committee reviews our executive compensation relative to the competitive market (based on an analysis of the compensation policies and practices of a select group of peer companies) every two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this purpose, the Compensation Committee uses a compensation peer group of companies for competitive market data to consider all aspects of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the Compensation Committee directed Compensia to assist with updating our compensation peer group and assessing the competitiveness of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating and making changes to the Compensation Peer Group, the Compensation Committee considered the following selection criteria: (1) location of the company (U.S.-based); (2) ownership structure of the company (publicly-traded); (3) companys industry (medical device or broader life sciences industry); (4) revenues (approximately 1/3 to 3x the company); and (5) market capitalization (approximately > 1/4 to 4x the company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the analysis performed by Compensia, the Compensation Committee approved the continued use in 2016 of the Compensation Peer Group selected for use in 2015 as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allergan CareFusion Hologic ResMed Zimmer H Becton Dickinson & Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cooper Companies Hospira St. Jude Medical   Boston Scientific Edwards Lifesciences IDEXX Laboratories Varian Medical Systems   C.R. Bard Endo International Illumina Waters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the compensation practices at peer companies to inform its decision-making process as it seeks to set total compensation levels it believes are reasonably competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, however, does not set compensation components to meet specific percentile levels (such as targeting base salaries above the median or equity compensation at the 75 th percentile).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Compensation Committee believes over-reliance on competitive positioning may result in compensation that is unrelated to the value delivered by our executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers, to the Company as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our executive compensation program was comprised of three principal elements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: base salaries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual performance-based cash bonuses; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term equity awards in the form of options to purchase shares of our common stock and RSUs that are settled in shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our executive officers are eligible to participate in our health and benefits programs, our employee stock purchase plan, and our Section 401(k) Plan on the same basis as our other eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the base salaries of our executive officers annually in July or August, or more frequently should there be a significant change in an executive officers role or responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating each executive officers base salary, the Compensation Committee considers the results achieved by the executive officer, his or her future potential, his or her role, scope of responsibilities and experience, competitive market practices, internal equity, and the recommendations of our Chief Executive Officer (except with respect to his own base salary).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed the base salaries of our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, for possible adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After taking into consideration our team-based approach to compensation, as well as the factors described above, the Compensation Committee set the base salaries of our Named Executive Officers as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer   Base Salary as of August 1, 2016   Base Salary as of August 1, 2015   Percentage Change Dr. Guthart  $ 735,000  $ 675,000   8.9% Mr. Brogna  $ 500,000  $ 470,000   6.4% Mr. Rosa  $ 525,000  $ 500,000   5.0% Mr. Meltzer  $ 410,000  $ 400,000   2.5% Mr. Mohr  $ 475,000  $ 460,000   3.3%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base salaries earned by our Named Executive Officers during 2016 are set forth in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Performance-Based Cash Bonuses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use annual cash bonuses to motivate our executive officers, who are not part of our salesforce, including our Named Executive Officers, to achieve our short-term financial and operational objectives while making progress towards our longer-term growth and other goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our executive compensation philosophy, these annual cash bonuses constitute a smaller portion of the target total direct compensation opportunity of our executive officers than their long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, cash bonus opportunities are provided pursuant to the Intuitive Surgical, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Incentive Program (the CIP), a formal cash bonus plan measuring and rewarding our executive officers for our corporate and their individual performance over the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CIP is designed to reward our executive officers for achieving stretch financial and operational objectives that are critical to the success of our business and which are aligned with the short-term and long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the CIP is an important element of our executive compensation program because it rewards our executive officers only for achieving the annual financial and operational objectives established each year by our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee reviews our annual performance-based cash bonus and commissions structures to ensure the design and payment structure falls in line with our compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of each year, the Compensation Committee determines the amount of the award to be paid to each executive officer by comparing actual results to the performance goals for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may, in its discretion, reduce or increase the amount of any individual award based on an executive officers overall performance and his or her contribution to the achievement of our performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Bonus Opportunities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given our emphasis on long-term stockholder value creation over annual operating results, the CIP targets are set relative to the competitive market, as reflected by the target annual cash bonus opportunities of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the target annual cash bonuses opportunities under the CIP for our Named Executive Officers were set as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Bonus Plan Formula and Funding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the CIP was funded through an incentive pool based on our achievement of an adjusted operating income (AOI) goal as set forth in our annual operating plan, and paid to our executive officers based on our actual level of achievement of AOI and several pre-established corporate performance objectives (the Company Performance Goals).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the CIP, AOI is defined as operating income excluding non-cash share-based compensation expense, non-cash amortization of intangible assets, and litigation charges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the CIP incentive pool was funded based on an AOI target set at the previous years AOI level plus a pre-established increase in AOI for the year and could be funded up to a maximum of 125% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the incentive pool that is paid out as annual cash bonuses for each Named Executive Officer is determined by an equal weighting of achievement of AOI goal and Company Performance Goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that the AOI target was not achieved, the incentive pool would not be funded, and our Named Executive Officers would not be eligible to receive any bonus under the CIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, the size of the CIP payout does not exceed the amount by which the incentive pool is funded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company Performance Goals are established at the corporate level and have been drawn from the categories of procedure growth, system sales growth and revenue growth, profitability, marketing objectives, customer training effectiveness, product development, regulatory approvals and compliance, new product introductions, quality of design and manufacture, applied research, and protecting intellectual property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company Performance Goals are initially established by the executive team and Dr. Guthart, then reviewed and approved by the Compensation Committee annually at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given their relationship to our annual operating plan and business strategy and because the Company Performance Goals and their specific target levels are highly confidential, we do not publicly disclose them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe their disclosure would provide our competitors, customers and other third parties with significant insights regarding our confidential business strategies that could cause us substantial competitive harm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nature of the Company Performance Goals and the weighting assigned to each are subject to change annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recurring goals are generally set above prior year results and budgeted levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company Performance Goals may be achieved at up to 125% of the target level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company Performance Goals are designed to be aggressive, and there is a risk that payments with respect to any specific goal will not be made at all or will be made at less than 100% of the target level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The achievement of the goals may be affected by several factors including, but not limited to, the impact of changes in healthcare legislation and policy, global and regional conditions, credit markets and the related impact on health care spending, timing and success of product development and market acceptance of developed products, changes in trade agreements and/or tariffs imposed on cross boarder commerce, and regulatory approvals, clearances and restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because several of these factors are not entirely within the control of our Named Executive Officers and given the stretch nature of the goal-setting process, we believe that it would be relatively difficult to fully achieve the Company Performance Goals in any year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The challenge of the goals and uncertainty in the environment ensures that any payments under the CIP are truly performance-based, which is consistent with the plans objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company Performance Goals for 2016 related to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: clinical and global expansion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: product development and innovation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: quality and customer satisfaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: efficiency and profitability; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other areas directed at long-term stockholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target and maximum performance levels were established for the AOI goal and for several of the Company Performance Goals which, collectively, could result in the payment of annual cash bonuses between 0% and 125% of the target annual cash bonus opportunities described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Bonus Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, target funding was set at AOI of $1,069 million and maximum funding of 125% of the pool was set at AOI of $1,181 million, with funding at intermediate levels determined based on linear interpolation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our actual achievement of AOI of $1,190 million or 125.0% achievement, weighted at 50% and actual achievement of Company Performance Goals of 102.1%, weighted at 50%, the CIP was funded at 113.6% of the target level for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term incentive compensation consists of equity awards in the form of options to purchase shares of our common stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and RSUs that are settled in shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant these equity awards to ensure that our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, have a continuing stake in our long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that these types of equity awards best meet our overall goals of alignment with long-term performance and stockholder value creation, and retention of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also believes granting awards with multi-year vesting requirements and, with respect to options, a 10-year term creates a substantial retention incentive and encourages our executive officers to focus on our long-term business objectives and long-term stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To determine the size of an individual equity award, the Compensation Committee first establishes a target compensation value to be delivered to each executive officer, including each Named Executive Officer, through long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, the Compensation Committee considers various factors, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the emphasis we place on equity in the mix of total compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executive officers experience and performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the scope, responsibility, and business impact of the executive officers position relative to other members of the executive team;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our financial and operational performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a review of competitive market data;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the recommendations of our Chief Executive Officer (except with respect to his own equity award); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the retention value of the total compensation package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a target award value has been established, the Compensation Committee determines the awards to be granted based on the current value of our common stock and presents its recommendations to our Board of Directors for their approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity awards granted to our Named Executive Officers in 2016 are set forth in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table and the 2016 Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Award Grant Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves annual equity award grants to our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options to purchase shares of our common stock are granted to our executive officers, bi-annually on February 15 and August 15 of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs are granted on February 15 of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The February stock option grants vest over a four-year period, while the August stock option grants vest over a 3.5-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs vest 25% annually over a four-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not time the granting of options to purchase shares of our common stock with any favorable or unfavorable news released by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The initial stock option grants are consistently granted on the fifth business day of the month after employment begins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proximity of any awards to an earnings announcement or other market events is coincidental.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Welfare and Other Employee Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have established a tax-qualified Section 401(k) retirement plan for all employees who satisfy certain eligibility requirements, including requirements relating to age and length of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2015, we began matching contributions made to the plan by our eligible employees, including executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We match 200% of employee contributions up to $1,500 per calendar year per person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All matching employer contributions are fully vested when made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we provide all of our full-time employees, including our Named Executive Officers, a variety of health-related benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits include medical, dental, and vision benefits, medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts, short- term and long-term disability insurance, accidental death and dismemberment insurance, and basic life insurance coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our employee benefits programs are intended to be affordable and competitive in relation to the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adjust our employee benefits programs as needed based upon regular monitoring of applicable laws and practices and the competitive market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites and Other Personal Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, we do not view perquisites or other personal benefits as a significant component of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we do not provide perquisites to our executive officers, except in limited situations where we believe it is appropriate to assist an individual in the performance of his or her duties, to make our executive officers more efficient and effective, and for recruitment and retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, we may provide perquisites or other personal benefits in limited circumstances, such as where we believe it is appropriate to assist an individual executive officer in the performance of his or her duties, to make our executive officers more efficient and effective, and for recruitment, motivation, or retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All future practices with respect to perquisites or other personal benefits will be approved and subject to periodic review by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Employment Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2008, our Board of Directors approved and adopted a change in control plan (the Change in Control Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Change in Control Plan, all eligible employees of the Company who have been employed at least six months prior to the date of their separation from service, including our executive officers, are eligible to receive certain payments and benefits in the event of a termination of employment without cause or an involuntary separation from service within 12 months after a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Change in Control Plan is beneficial to our stockholders because it minimizes the uncertainty presented to our valuable workforce in the case of a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we provide the Change in Control Plan to encourage our employees to work at a dynamic and rapidly growing business where their long-term compensation largely depends on future stock price appreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of our executive officers, the Change in Control Plan is intended to mitigate a potential disincentive for them when they are evaluating a potential acquisition of the Company, particularly when the services of the executive officers may not be required by the acquiring entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such a situation, we believe that these protections are necessary to encourage retention of the executive officers through the conclusion of the transaction, and to ensure a smooth management transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments and benefits provided under the Change in Control Plan have been designed to provide our eligible employees, including our executive officers, with consistent treatment that is competitive with current market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A description of the terms and conditions of the Change in Control Plan, as well as information about the estimated payments and benefits that our Named Executive Officers would have been eligible to receive as of December 31, 2016, are set forth in Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that stock ownership by our Named Executive Officers and the members of our Board of Directors is important to link the risks and rewards inherent in stock ownership of these individuals and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2015, our Board of Directors adopted executive officer stock ownership guidelines requiring each individual serving as an executive officer to maintain beneficial ownership of a minimum dollar amount of shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the purposes of determining stock ownership levels, the following forms of equity interests are included: shares owned outright by, or held in trust for the benefit of, the executive officer or his or her spouse or children; shares held through a fund or other entity as to which the executive officer has control; shares of our common stock, stock units or other stock equivalents obtained through the exercise of stock options or vesting of Company equity awards; vested equity awards granted under our equity plans; and other stock or stock equivalent awards determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stock ownership guidelines are intended to create a clear standard that encourages these executives to remain invested in the performance of our stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive officer has five years from the date he or she becomes subject to the stock ownership guidelines to achieve compliance with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current ownership levels specified by these guidelines require each Named Executive Officer to maintain a minimum level of stock ownership equal to four times his annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum required level of ownership for each of our Named Executive Officers and their stock ownership deadlines, as well as whether the Name Executive Officer has already met the requirement, are as follows:

Guthart  $ 2,940,000   1/1/2020   Yes David J. Rosa  $ 2,100,000   1/1/2020   Yes Salvatore J. Brogna  $ 2,000,000   1/1/2020   No Marshall L. Mohr  $ 1,900,000   1/1/2020   Yes Mark J. Meltzer  $ 1,640,000   1/1/2020   Yes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recovery Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, we have not implemented a policy regarding retroactive adjustments to any cash or equity-based incentive compensation paid to our executive officers and other employees where the payments were predicated upon the achievement of financial results that were subsequently the subject of a financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivatives Trading, Hedging, and Pledging Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Insider Trading Policy provides that no employee, officer, or director may acquire, sell, or trade in any interest or position relating to the future price of Company securities, such as a put option, a call option or a short sale (including a short sale against the box), or engage in hedging transactions (including cashless collars).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Insider Trading Policy provides that no employee, officer, or director to may pledge Company securities as collateral to secure loans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This prohibition means, among other things, that these individuals may not hold Company securities in a margin account, which would allow the individual to borrow against their holdings to buy securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code generally disallows public companies a tax deduction for federal income tax purposes of remuneration in excess of $1 million paid to the chief executive officer and each of the three other most highly-compensated executive officers (other than the chief financial officer) in any taxable year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, remuneration in excess of $1 million may generally be deducted if it is qualified performance based compensation within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, the compensation income realized upon the exercise of stock options granted under a stockholder-approved stock option plan generally will be deductible so long as the options are granted by a committee whose members are non-employee directors and certain other conditions are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As currently structured, any income realized from vesting of RSUs may not be deductible if, when combined with other remuneration for tax year, exceeds in the aggregate $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that, in establishing the cash and equity incentive compensation plans and arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for our executive officers, the potential deductibility of the compensation payable under those plans and arrangements should be only one of a number of relevant factors taken into consideration, and not the sole governing factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For that reason, the Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee may deem it appropriate to provide one or more executive officer with the opportunity to earn incentive compensation, whether through cash incentive awards tied to our financial performance or equity incentive awards tied to the executive officers continued service, which may be in excess of the amount deductible by reason of Section 162(m) or other provisions of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes it is important to maintain cash and equity incentive compensation at the requisite level to attract and retain the individuals essential to our financial success, even if all or part of that compensation may not be deductible by reason of the Section 162(m) limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee takes into account whether components of the compensation for our executive officers will be adversely impacted by the penalty tax imposed by Section 409A of the Code, and aims to structure these components to be compliant with or exempt from Section 409A to avoid such potential adverse tax consequences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Golden Parachute Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sections 280G and 4999 of the Code provide that certain executive officers and other service providers who are highly compensated or hold significant equity interests may be subject to an excise tax if they receive payments or benefits in connection with a change in control of the company that exceeds certain prescribed limits, and that we, or a successor, may forfeit a deduction on the amounts subject to this additional tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not provide any executive officer, including any Named Executive Officer, with a gross-up or other reimbursement payment for any tax liability that he or she might owe as a result of the application of Sections 280G or 4999 during 2016 and we have not agreed and are not otherwise obligated to provide any Named Executive Officer with such a gross-up or other reimbursement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting for Share-Based Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We follow Financial Accounting Standard Board ("FASB") Accounting Standards Codification Topic 718, ("ASC Topic 718"), for our share-based compensation awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ASC Topic 718 requires companies to measure the compensation expense for all share-based payment awards made to employees and directors, including stock options and RSUs, based on the grant date fair value of these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This calculation is performed for accounting purposes and reported in the compensation tables below, even though our executive officers may never realize any value from their awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ASC Topic 718 also requires companies to recognize the compensation cost of their share-based compensation awards in their income statements over the period that an executive officer is required to render service in exchange for the option or other award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION RISK CONSIDERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers, in establishing and reviewing our employee compensation programs, whether each of these programs encourages unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company, after reviewing and discussing the compensation programs with the Compensation and Audit Committees of our Board of Directors, believes that the programs are balanced and do not motivate or encourage unnecessary or excessive risk taking because of, in part, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are fixed in amount and thus do not encourage risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While performance-based awards focus on achievement of short-term or annual goals, and short-term goals may encourage the taking of short-term risks at the expense of long-term results, the Companys performance-based award programs represent a reasonable portion of employees target total direct compensation opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based awards are based on various departmental and Company-wide metrics; funding for the awards is capped at the Company level and the distribution of the funds to executive officers and other employees is at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term equity awards are important to help further align employees interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ultimate value of the awards is tied to the Companys stock price and since awards are staggered and subject to long-term vesting schedules, they help ensure that our executive officers have significant value tied to long-term stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, we have established procedures related to the timing and approval of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the above, we believe that our employee compensation programs appropriately balance risk and the desire to focus employees on specific short-term goals important to the Companys success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows potential payments to the NEOs upon a change in control of the Company and subsequent involuntary separation from service within 12 months after the change in control, in accordance with the Change in Control Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this plan, all eligible employees of the Company who have been employed at least six months prior to the separation from service date, including executive officers, are entitled to the following severance payments and benefits in the event of a termination of employment without cause or an involuntary separation from service within 12 months after a change in control of the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump sum cash payment in the amount equal to the sum of six months of such eligible employees base compensation (defined in the Change in Control Plan as base salary and target bonus) plus an additional one month of base compensation for every year of such eligible employees service with the Company, such severance not to exceed 12 months;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: six months of COBRA premiums, provided that such eligible employee elects continued coverage under COBRA; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 100% vesting of all outstanding unvested equity awards that the eligible employee then holds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts shown assume that a qualifying termination of employment was effective December 31, 2016, the last business day of the year, under the Change in Control Plan and are estimates of the amounts that would be paid to the NEOs upon such a termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Change in Control Plan, an involuntary separation from service of a Named Executive Officer generally means, (i) without the executives express written consent, the assignment to the executive of any duties or the significant reduction of the executives duties, authority or responsibilities, which is inconsistent with the executives duties, authority or responsibilities in effect immediately prior to such assignment, or the removal of the executive from such duties, authority or responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a reduction by the Company in the base compensation of the executive as in effect immediately prior to such reduction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a material reduction by the Company in the kind or level of employee benefits to which the executive is entitled immediately prior to such reduction with the result that the executives overall benefits package is significantly reduced;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the relocation of the executive to a facility or a location more than 25 miles from the executives then present location, without the executives express written consent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) any purported termination of the executive by the Company which is not effected for disability or for cause, or any purported termination for which the grounds relied upon are not valid;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) the failure of the Company to obtain the assumption of the agreement by any successors contemplated in the Change in Control Plan; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) any act or set of facts or circumstances which would, under California case law or statute constitute a constructive termination of the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for an executive to terminate employment in an involuntary separation from service, he or she must provide notice to the Company of the existence of a condition listed above, within 30 days of the initial existence of the condition, and the Company shall have 30 days following receipt of such notice to remedy such condition and not make any payments hereunder in connection with such termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments and benefits pursuant to the Change in Control Plan are subject to the Named Executive Officers timely execution and non-revocation of a release of claims.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Change in Control Plan specifically include a so-called parachute payment "best pay" provision, where payments and benefits will either be made to the executive in full or as to such lesser amount as which would result in no portion of the payments and benefits being subject to an excise tax under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code, whichever of the foregoing amounts is greater on an after-tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that the following directors and director nominee are independent under current NASDAQ rules: Craig H. Barratt, Michael A. Friedman, Amal M. Johnson, Keith R. Leonard, Jr., Alan J. Levy, Jami Dover Nachtsheim, Mark J. Rubash, Lonnie M. Smith, and George Stalk, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted a written policy for approval of transactions between the Company and its related parties, such as directors, director nominees, executive officers, greater than five percent beneficial owners, and each of their respective immediate family members, as well as any firm, corporation or other entity in which such persons are employed, serve as general partner, principal or similar position or in which such persons own a five percent or greater beneficial ownership interest, where the amount involved in the transaction exceeds or is expected to exceed $120,000 in a single calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the Audit Committee review transactions subject to the policy and determine whether or not to approve or ratify those transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, they take into account:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the terms of the transaction are fair to the Company and on the same basis as would apply if the transaction did not involve a related party;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether there are business reasons for the Company to enter into the related party transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction would impair the independence of an outside director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction would present an improper conflict of interest for any director or executive officer of the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any other factors deemed appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Audit Committee may participate in the approval of a related party transaction for which he or she is a related party.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each of the following types of related party transactions are deemed to be approved under the policy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation to an executive officer or director of the Company required to be disclosed in the Proxy Statement pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K; or compensation to an executive officer who is not an immediate family member of a related party, provided that such compensation would have been reported pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K as compensation earned for services to the Company if the executive was a named executive officer, and such compensation has been approved, or recommended to the Board for approval, by the Compensation Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following transactions that are in the Companys ordinary course of business and where the financial interest of the related party arises only in the following indirect manners:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a) from the related partys position as a director of another corporation or organization that is a party to the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: b) from the direct or indirect ownership by the related party (or parties, in the aggregate) of less than a 10% equity interes in another person (other than a partnership) which is a party to the transaction; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: c) from the related partys position as a limited partner in a partnership in which the related party (or parties, in the aggregate) has or have an interest of less than 10%, and the related party is not a general partner of and does not have another position in the partnership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions that are in the Companys ordinary course of business and where the interest of the related party arises solely from the ownership of a class of equity securities in the Company and all holders of such class of equity securities of the Company will receive the same benefit on a pro rata basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of all material related party transactions, if any, is provided to the Audit Committee for its review at each regularly scheduled Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If advance approval of a related party transaction is not feasible, then the transaction may be preliminarily entered into by management upon prior approval by the Chair of the Audit Committee and will be subject to ratification by the Audit Committee at the next regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since January 1, 2016, we have not been a party to, and we have no plans to be a party to, any transaction or series of similar transactions in which the amount involved exceeded or will exceed $120,000 and in which any director, executive officer, director nominee, holder of more than five percent of our voting securities, any member of the immediate family of any of the foregoing or any entity in which such persons are employed or have a greater than five percent interest as noted above, had or will have a direct or indirect material interest.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All audit services, audit-related services, tax services, and other services were pre-approved by our Audit Committee, which concluded that the provision of such services was compatible with the maintenance of PwC's independence in the conduct of its auditing functions.

sentences.text: The Audit Committees pre-approval policy provides for the pre-approval of audit, audit-related, tax, and other services specifically described by the committee on an annual basis, and unless a type of service is pre-approved under the policy, it will require separate pre-approval by the committee if it is to be provided by the independent registered public accounting firm.

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following audit committee report shall not be deemed incorporated by reference into any filing under the Securities Act of 1933 or the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and shall not otherwise be deemed filed under these acts, except to the extent we specifically incorporate by reference into such filings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee is composed of independent directors, as determined in accordance with NASDAQ Stock Markets Rules and Rule 10A-3 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has certain duties and powers as described in its written charter adopted by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the charter can be found on the Companys website at www.intuitivesurgical.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in its charter, the purpose of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board of Directors with its oversight responsibilities regarding the integrity of our Companys financial statements, our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, assessing the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications and independence, and the performance of the persons performing the internal audit duties for our Company and the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a full- time Internal Audit department that reports to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internal Audit department is responsible for objectively reviewing and evaluating the adequacy, effectiveness, and quality of the Companys internal controls related to, for example, the reliability and integrity of the Companys financial reporting process and the safeguarding of the Companys assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for preparation, presentation, and integrity of our financial statements as well as our financial reporting process, accounting policies, internal audit function, internal accounting controls, and disclosure controls and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP ("PwC"), the Company's independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for performing an independent audit of our consolidated financial statements in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards and to issue a report thereon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees responsibility is to monitor and oversee these processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is the Audit Committees report submitted to the Board of Directors for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewed and discussed our audited financial statements with management and PwC, the independent auditors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discussed with PwC the matters required to be discussed by the Statement on Auditing Standards No. 61, as amended (AICPA, Professional Standards, Vol. 1, AU section 380), as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board in Rule 3200T; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: received from PwC the written disclosures and the letter required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent auditors communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and discussed with the auditors their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has met separately with management and with PwC
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 6 requests the approval of an amendment and restatement of the Company's 2010 Incentive Award Plan.
