sentences.text: Each of the proposals is discussed in more detail in the pages that follow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has nine authorized seats.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stalk has notified the Company of his decision to retire and will not seek re- election at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jami Dover Nachtsheim and all of the Companys current directors, except Mr. Stalk, have been nominated for election at the Annual Meeting to serve a one-year term expiring at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until a successor has been duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Craig H. Barratt, Michael A. Friedman, Gary S. Guthart, Ph.D., Amal M. Johnson, Keith R. Leonard, Jr., Alan J. Levy, Ph.D., Jami Dover Nachtsheim, Mark J. Rubash, and Lonnie M. Smith have been nominated by the Board of Directors to serve as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to Directors and Corporate Governance section above for the nominees biographies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Bylaws provide for a majority voting standard in uncontested elections of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, in an election where the number of nominees for director does not exceed the number of directors to be elected, a nominee for director will be elected to the Board of Directors if the number of shares voted for the nominee exceeds the number of shares voted against the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority voting standard would not apply, however, if the number of nominees for director exceeds the number of directors to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case, the nominees receiving the highest number of affirmative votes of the shares entitled to vote at the meeting would be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority voting standard will apply to the election taking place at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, in order to be elected, a nominee must receive more for votes than against votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may not be voted for more than the nine nominees, and stockholders may not cumulate votes in the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event any nominee is unable or declines to serve as a director at the time of the meeting, the proxies will be voted for the nominee, if any, who may be designated by the Board of Directors to fill the vacancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares represented by the accompanying proxy will be voted for the election of the nominees recommended by the Board of Directors unless the proxy is marked in such a manner so as to withhold authority to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that any nominee should be unavailable for election as a result of an unexpected occurrence, such shares will be voted for the election of such substitute nominee as management may propose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each person nominated for election has agreed to serve if elected, and the Board of Directors has no reason to believe that any nominee will be unable to serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the votes cast is required to elect each of the director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that to be elected a nominee must receive more for votes than against votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that stockholders vote FOR the election of Craig H. Barratt, Ph.D., Michael A. Friedman, Gary S. Guthart, Ph.D., Amal M. Johnson, Jami Dover Nachtsheim, Keith R. Leonard, Jr., Alan J. Levy, Ph.D., Mark J. Rubash, and Lonnie M. Smith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY APPROVAL OF THE COMPENSATION OF NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary objective of our executive compensation program is to attract and retain a talented, entrepreneurial, and creative team of executives who will provide leadership to make surgery more effective, less invasive, and easier on surgeons, patients, and their families.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company accomplishes this goal in a manner consistent with its strategy, competitive practice, sound corporate governance principles, and stockholder interests and concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes the compensation program for the NEOs is strongly aligned with the long-term interests of its stockholders and was instrumental in helping the Company achieve its financial performance in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Companys 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, our stockholders approved the compensation of our NEOs, with over 97% of the votes cast voted in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee continues to apply the same principles and philosophy it has used in previous years in determining executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It will continue to consider stockholder concerns and feedback in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is continuously working to ensure that managements interests are aligned with our stockholders interests to support long-term value creation and will continue to consider the outcome of the Companys say-on-pay votes when making future compensation decisions for the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) section above for a more detailed discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are urged to read the Executive Compensation section of this Proxy Statement, including the CD&A section which discusses the Companys compensation policies and practices, and the 2016 compensation for the Companys NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board believe that the Companys compensation policies and practices are effective in achieving the Companys goals and are consistent with stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has determined to hold a separate stockholder vote on the compensation of our NEOs every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, as a matter of good corporate governance and in accordance with Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are including in this Proxy Statement a separate stockholder vote on the approval of the NEOs compensation, which vote is non-binding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we are asking you to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys NEOs, as described in the Executive Compensation section of this Proxy Statement, including the CD&A section and the related compensation tables and other narrative executive compensation disclosure contained therein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following resolution will be submitted for a stockholder vote at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Intuitive Surgical approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of Intuitive Surgicals named executive officers, as disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and narrative discussion of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the advisory vote is non-binding, the Compensation Committee and the Board will review the results of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will consider our stockholders concerns to the extent there is any significant vote against the NEOs' compensation as disclosed in this Proxy Statement and take them into account in future determinations concerning our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Compensation Committee or the Board modifies the Companys determination in the frequency of future advisory stockholder votes on the compensation of the NEOs, the next advisory board vote will be held at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board therefore recommends that you indicate your support for the Companys compensation policies and practices as reflected in the compensation of the NEOs, as outlined above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that stockholders vote, on an advisory basis, FOR the approval of the named executive officers compensation described in the CD&A, the compensation tables and the narrative discussion of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF VOTE ON THE COMPENSATION OF NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act, we are including in this Proxy Statement a separate stockholder vote on how frequently the advisory vote described under Proposal No. 2 (the Advisory Approval on the Compensation of Named Executive Officers) should occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with the Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Named Executive Officers, the vote described in this Proposal No. 3 is non-binding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this vote is non-binding, the Compensation Committee and the Board will review the results of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that providing stockholders with the Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Named Executive Officers once every year will be the most effective means for conducting and responding to the Advisory Vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It provides the most consistent and clear communication channel for stockholders to express their views on our executive compensation program every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board has determined that providing stockholders with the Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Named Executive Officers once every year is advisable, and therefore recommends that you approve an annual vote, the Compensation Committee and the Board will consider our stockholders concerns and take them into account in determining how frequently the Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Named Executive Officers occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that stockholders vote, on an advisory basis, for the Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Named Executive Officers to occur once every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys independent registered public accounting firm and its auditors for the year ended December 31, 2016, were PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP ("PwC").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, the stockholders are being asked to ratify the appointment of PwC as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the year ended December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a negative vote on such ratification, the Audit Committee will reconsider its selection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if this appointment is ratified, the Audit Committee, in its discretion, may direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if the Audit Committee determines that such a change would be in the best interest of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of PwC are expected to be present at the Annual Meeting and available to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of Proposal No. 4 requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR the ratification of appointment of PwC as the Company's independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPROVAL OF AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF THE 2000 EMPLOYEE STOCK PURCHASE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking you to approve the amendment and restatement of the Intuitive Surgical, Inc. 2000 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (the ESPP), which increases the shares of common stock reserved for issuance by 500,000 shares from 2,030,105 shares under the ESPP as in effect as of February 4, 2010 (the "Prior ESPP"), thereby increasing the total number of shares reserved for issuance to 2,530,105.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP also incorporates an amendment adopted by the Board on February 4, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has unanimously adopted, subject to stockholder approval, the ESPP for employees of the Company and its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Per the requirements set forth in the ESPP, the ESPP will become effective if approved by the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP was originally adopted by the Board in March 2000 and approved by our shareholders in April 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the ESPP is to provide our employees the opportunity to purchase common stock shares of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP is intended to qualify as an employee stock purchase plan under Section 423 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP is an important component of the benefits package that we offer to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it is a key factor in retaining existing employees, recruiting new employees, and aligning and increasing the interest of all employees in the success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors have approved and are asking you to approve the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background on Share Request
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the ESPP is an important component of the Companys overall portfolio of employee benefits, and serves as a valuable incentive in further aligning Company employees interests with those of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board believes that it is in the Companys and the stockholders best interests to ensure that the ESPP has access to a sufficient number of shares of company common stock to allow the ESPP to continue to operate without restriction or interruption for at least the next five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on current employee-participation rates in the ESPP, the Company expects that the number of shares allocated for issuance under the Prior ESPP will be exhausted during 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board proposes to amend and restate the Prior ESPP to allow for the issuance of an additional 500,000 shares of Company common stock under the ESPP, which it has determined is reasonable and appropriate at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of the Employee Stock Purchase Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal features of the ESPP are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summary of the ESPP does not purport to be a complete description of all of the provisions of the ESPP, but is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the ESPP, which is attached as Exhibit A to this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP will be administered by our Compensation Committee, which has broad authority to construe the ESPP and to make determinations with respect to the terms and conditions of each offering period under the ESPP, awards, and other matters pertaining to plan administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common Stock Reserved for Issuance under the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shares of common stock available for sale under the ESPP is 2,530,105.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The common stock made available for sale under the ESPP may be authorized but unissued shares, reacquired shares reserved for issuance under the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participating Subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan administrator may designate certain of our subsidiaries as participating subsidiaries in the ESPP and may change these designations from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible Employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our employees and those of our designated participating subsidiaries who are customarily scheduled to work at least 20 hours per week and whose customary employment is more than five months in a calendar year are generally eligible to participate in the ESPP, though employees who would own 5% or more of the total combined voting power or value of all classes of our stock or the stock of one of our subsidiaries after the granting of an option under the ESPP are not allowed to participate in the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 24, 2017, there were approximately 7 current executive officers and 2,911 current non-executive officer employees who would be eligible to participate in the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors are not eligible to participate in the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the ESPP, eligible employees may generally elect to contribute and apply to the purchase of shares of common stock between 1% and 15% of their eligible earnings during an offering period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options granted under the ESPP are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: exercisable on specified exercise dates only through funds accumulated by an employee through payroll deductions made during the applicable offering period, and any such funds that are not used to purchase shares will be returned to the employee unless the amount in respect of an employee is less than the purchase price of a share in such purchase or offering period, in which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: case, they will be carried forward to the next purchase or offering period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may not accrue the right to purchase stock under the ESPP (or any other tax-qualified stock purchase plan) with a fair market value exceeding $25,000 in any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation in the ESPP is voluntary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Offering Periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the ESPP, employees are offered the option to purchase discounted shares of common stock during offering periods designated by the plan administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each offering period will be 24 months long and shall be divided into four shorter purchase periods of approximately six (6) months in duration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Offerings shall be concurrent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A new offering shall start every six (6) months on every February 1 and August 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options are granted on the first day of each purchase period and are automatically exercised on the last trading day of each purchase period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may enroll in only one offering at a time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If on the first or last day of any purchase period during an offering, the fair market value of the shares is less than it was on the offering date for that offering, then the offering shall immediately terminate, and the employees who were enrolled in the terminated offering shall automatically be enrolled in the new offering that starts on such date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Purchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purchase price of the shares under the offering shall be the lesser of 85% of the fair market value of the shares on the offering date and 85% of the fair market value of the shares on the purchase date, in each case rounded up to the nearest whole cent per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 24, 2017, the closing price of our common stock on the NASDAQ Global Select Market was $736.86 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless a participant has previously canceled his or her participation in the ESPP and elected to withdraw all of the funds then credited to his or her ESPP account, an amount equal to the amount credited to his or her ESPP account will be used to purchase the maximum number of whole shares of common stock that can be purchased based on the amount credited to such participant's account on the purchase date, subject to individual and aggregate share limitations under the applicable offering period established by the plan administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No fractional shares will be issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may not increase his or her deductions during the course of a purchase period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may increase or decrease his or her deductions prior to the beginning of a new purchase period or a new offering, to be effective at the beginning of such new purchase period or new offering.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant shall make a change in his or her participation level by delivering a notice to the Company in such form and at such time as the Company provides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may reduce (including to zero) his or her deductions once during a purchase period, effective as soon as administratively practicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant shall make a change in his or her participation level by delivering a notice to the Company in such form and at such time as the Company provides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may withdraw from an offering and receive his or her accumulated payroll deductions from the offering (reduced to the extent, if any, such deductions have been used to acquire shares for the participant on any prior purchase dates), without interest, or reduce his or her participation percentage to zero (0), at any time prior to the end of the offering, excluding only each 13 day period immediately preceding a purchase date (or such shorter period of time determined by the Company and communicated to participants) by delivering a withdrawal notice to the Company in such form as the Company provides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Eligibility and Transferability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant ceases to be an eligible employee for any reason during an offering period, he or she will be deemed to have elected to withdraw from the ESPP and any amounts credited to the participant's ESPP account will be returned to the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options granted under the ESPP are not transferable other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution and are exercisable only by the participant during the participant's lifetime.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of any stock dividend, stock split, combination or reclassification of shares or any other increase or decrease in the number of shares of common stock effected without receipt of consideration, the plan administrator has broad discretion to equitably adjust the number of shares authorized for issuance and awards under the ESPP to prevent the dilution or enlargement of benefits under outstanding awards as a result of such transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a dissolution, liquidation or sale of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a merger or consolidation where the Company is not the surviving corporation or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a reverse merger where the Companys outstanding shares are converted by virtue of the merger into other property even if the Company is the surviving corporation, each outstanding option under an ongoing purchase period shall be assumed or an equivalent option substituted by the successor corporation or acquiring corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the successor corporation or acquiring corporation refuses to assume or substitute for the outstanding options under the ESPP, then, the Board, as determined in its sole discretion, may continue the options to purchase shares in full force and effect or the participants accumulated payroll deductions may be used to purchase shares immediately prior to a transaction described above under the ongoing offering period and the participants options under the ongoing offering period thereafter terminate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Insufficient Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the total number of shares of common stock which are to be purchased under outstanding purchase rights on any particular date exceed the number of shares then available for issuance under the ESPP, the plan administrator will make a pro rata allocation of the available shares on a uniform and equitable basis, and unless additional shares are authorized under the ESPP, no
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: further offering periods will take place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this event, excess payroll deductions will be refunded to participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment or Termination of the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may amend, modify or terminate the ESPP at any time without notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, an ESPP amendment will be subject to stockholder approval to the extent it is required by applicable laws, except if it is a minor amendment of the ESPP that takes into account a change in legislation or obtains favorable tax, exchange control or regulatory treatment for participants of the ESPP or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants options and obligations under any options granted before the amendment of the ESPP will not be impaired by any amendment to the ESPP, except as provided in the ESPP or with the consent of such participant or if it is necessary to comply with any laws or governmental regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a general summary under current law of the material federal income tax consequences to an employee who participates in the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary deals with the general federal income tax principles that apply and is provided only for general information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some kinds of taxes, such as state, local and foreign income taxes and federal employment taxes, are not discussed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax laws are complex and subject to change and may vary depending on individual circumstances and from locality to locality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The summary does not discuss all aspects of federal income taxation that may be relevant in light of a participant's personal circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summarized tax information is not tax advice and a participant of an award should rely on the advice of his or her legal and tax advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP, and the right of participants to make purchases thereunder, is intended to qualify for special tax treatment under the provisions of Section 423 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the applicable Code provisions, no income will be taxable to a participant until the sale or other disposition of the shares purchased under the ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon such sale or disposition, the participant will generally be subject to tax in an amount that depends upon the length of time such shares are held by the participant prior to disposing of them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shares are sold or disposed of more than two years from the first day of the offering period during which the shares were purchased (the "Grant Date") and one year from the date of purchase, or if the participant dies while holding the shares, the participant (or his or her estate) will recognize ordinary income measured as the lesser of (1) the excess of the fair market value of the shares at the time of such sale or disposition over the purchase price or (2) the excess of the fair market value of the shares on the date the Company granted the option over the purchase price paid for the shares, determined assuming that the option was exercised on the Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any additional gain will be treated as a capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shares are sold or otherwise disposed of before the expiration of the holding periods described above, the participant will recognize ordinary income generally measured as the excess of the fair market value of the shares on the date the shares are purchased over the purchase price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any additional gain or loss on such sale or disposition will be long-term or short-term capital gain or loss, depending on how long the shares were held following the date they were purchased by the participant prior to disposing of them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are entitled to a deduction to the extent of ordinary income recognized upon a sale or disposition of shares prior to the expiration of the holding periods described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the number of shares that may be purchased under the ESPP will depend on each employee's voluntary election to participate and on the fair market value of our common stock at various future dates, the actual number of shares that may be purchased by any individual cannot be determined in advance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards Granted Under the ESPP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of January 31, 2017, the number of options granted at any time under the ESPP to date to Dr. Guthart, and Messrs. Meltzer, Mohr, Brogna, and Rosa were 0; 1,058; 1,542; 4,540; and 10,597 options, respectively; by all current executive officers as a group was 18,598 options; by all current directors who were not executive officers as a group was 0 options; by each associate of any of such directors, executive officers or nominees was 0; by each other person who received 5 percent of such options or rights was 0; by all employees who were not executive officers as a group was 1,931,298 options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the Amended ESPP requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that stockholders vote FOR the amendment and restatement of the Employee Stock Purchase Plan to increase the number of shares of common stock under Amended ESPP from 2,030,105 to 2,530,105.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPROVAL OF AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF THE INTUITIVE SURGICAL, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2010 INCENTIVE AWARD PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking you to approve the amendment and restatement to Intuitive Surgical, Inc. 2010 Incentive Award Plan (the Amended 2010 Plan), which increases the shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the Intuitive Surgical, Inc. 2010 Incentive Award Plan, as previously amended and restated effective January 28, 2016 (the 2010 Plan), by 1,100,000 shares from 7,050,000 shares, thereby increasing the total number of shares reserved for issuance to 8,150,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has unanimously adopted, subject to stockholder approval, the Amended 2010 Plan for employees and other service providers of the Company and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Per the requirements set forth in the 2010 Plan, the Amended 2010 Plan will become effective if approved by the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Amended 2010 Plan is not approved by our stockholders, it will not become effective, the 2010 Plan will continue in effect, and we may continue to grant awards under the 2010 Plan, subject to its terms, conditions and limitations, using the shares available for issuance thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the above, we are asking stockholders to approve the Amended 2010 Plan to satisfy the stockholder approva requirements of Section 162(m) of the Code (Section 162(m)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, Section 162(m) places a limit on the deductibility for federal income tax purposes of the compensation paid to our Chief Executive Officer or any of our three other most highly compensated executive officers (other than our Chief Financial Officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m), compensation paid to such persons in excess of $1 million in a taxable year generally is not deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, compensation that qualifies as performance-based under Section 162(m) does not count against the $1 million deduction limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the requirements of performance-based compensation for purposes of Section 162(m) is that the material terms of the plan under which compensation may be paid be disclosed to and approved by our public stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of Section 162(m), the material terms include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the employees eligible to receive compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) a description of the business criteria on which the performance goals may be based and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the maximum amount of compensation that can be paid to an employee under the performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these aspects of the Amended 2010 Plan is discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder approval of the Amended 2010 Plan is only one of several requirements under Section 162(m) that must be satisfied for amounts realized under the Amended 2010 Plan to qualify for the performance-based compensation exemption under Section 162(m), and submission of the material terms of the Amended 2010 Plans performance goals for stockholder approval should not be viewed as a guarantee that we will be able to deduct all compensation under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in this proposal precludes us or the Compensation Committee from making any payment or granting awards that do not qualify for tax deductibility under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We designed the 2010 Plan with the intent to conform to best practices in equity compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2010 Plan was initially approved by shareholders on April 21, 2010 and reserved a total of 1,250,000 shares thereunder, and replaced our previously expiring 2000 Equity Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2010 Plan adopted many features designed to address stockholders concerns related to equity incentive plans such as prohibiting repricing, eliminating evergreen share replenishment features, granting only non-discounted options, and disallowing transfer of options to third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the years following its adoption, the 2010 Plan has been amended and restated, most recently in 2016, among other things, to increase the number of shares of common stock reserved for issuance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To continue to align the long-term interests of our employees with those of our stockholders, and attract and retain the highest quality of talent in a highly competitive labor market, we have determined to amend and restate the 2010 Plan to further increase the number of shares of common stock reserved for issuance by 1,100,000 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our request is approximately 3.0% of the total shares of common stock outstanding as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board have approved and are asking you to approve the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-approval of the Amended 2010 Plan may compel the Company to increase the cash component of employee compensation because the Company would need to replace components of compensation previously delivered in equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that long-term equity awards are an extremely important way to attract and retain a talented executive team and align the executives interests with the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past several years, the Companys investment in the expansion of robotic surgery, including development of da Vinci Surgical Systems, development of surgical instruments and accessories, regulatory approval and compliance, expanding surgical applications, training surgeons and surgical teams and otherwise expanding the market for our products, has resulted in exceptional growth in the Companys revenue and earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: from 2008 through 2016, the Companys annual revenue grew from $875 million to $2.7 billion; net income grew from $204 million to $736 million, while the Companys cash and investments grew from $902 million at December 31, 2008 to $4.8
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: billion at December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From March 2009 through December 31, 2016, the Company has also repurchased 9.1 million shares of its outstanding common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys success has also resulted in a significant increase in stockholder value as the Companys market capitalization grew from $5.0 billion at December 31, 2008 to $24.6 billion at December 31, 2016, an increase of approximately 392%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the Companys success is due to its highly talented employee base and that future success depends on the ability to attract and retain high-caliber employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys engineering operations are primarily located in Silicon Valley, where it must compete with many technology companies, including high profile start-ups, for a limited pool of talented people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also compete with other large medical device companies for a limited pool of exceptional sales and service personnel globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ability to grant equity awards is a necessary and powerful recruiting and retention tool for the Company to obtain the high-quality employees it needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2009 Employment Commencement Incentive Plan and the 2010 Plan are our only active employee equity plans (other than our Employee Stock Purchase Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2009 Employment Commencement Incentive Plan is used to make grants to newly hired employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of January 31, 2017, the Compensation Committee anticipates that the 1,100,000 shares requested under the Amended 2010 Plan, plus 1,747,258 shares available for issuance under the 2010 Plan prior to the amendment and restatement will enable the Company to fund its equity compensation program for employees not covered by the 2009 Employment Commencement Incentive Plan through the date of our 2019 Annual Meeting, accommodating anticipated grants relating to the hiring, retention and promotion of employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee (which administers our equity plans) recognizes its responsibility to strike a balance between stockholder concerns regarding the potential dilutive effect of equity awards and the ability to attract, retain and reward employees whose contributions are critical to the long-term success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company stresses a team approach and environment, believes that all employees should be driving a common set of goals and believes that our employees interests should be aligned with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, all U.S. employees and nearly all non-U.S. employees are granted long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Burn Rate and Overhang
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In administering our equity program, we consider both our burn rate and our overhang.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define burn rate as the number of equity awards granted in the year, net of cancellations, divided by the sum of the undiluted weighted average shares of our common stock outstanding during the year plus the number of options that have been issued and are outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The burn rate measures the potential dilutive effect of our annual equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We granted 339,979 stock options and 344,868 RSUs in 2016 and 74,812 stock options and 35,379 RSUs were forfeited or canceled in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the number of weighted average shares outstanding was 38,346,278, and the total number of stock options and RSUs outstanding was 3,088,539 and 598,226 respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, our burn rate was 1.4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our three-year average burn rate from fiscal 2014 through fiscal 2016 was 1.2%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We define overhang as the equity awards outstanding but not exercised, plus equity awards available to be granted (the available equity award shares), divided by the total shares of common stock outstanding plus the available equity award shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overhang measures the potential dilutive effect of outstanding equity awards and future awards available for grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows the details of equity awards available for grant as of January 31, 2017, and as of December 31, 2016, including overhang calculations, and assumes stockholders approve the Amended 2010 Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: January 31, 2017   December 31, 2016 2010 Plan 1,747,258   1,743,480 Proposed shares under the Amended 2010 Plan 1,100,000    2009 Employment Commencement Incentive Plan 120,137   131,045 2000 Non-employee Directors Stock Option Plan 48,322   48,322 Total estimated shares available to grant 3,015,717   1,922,847 Options and RSUs outstanding 3,611,686   3,686,775 Total overhang 6,627,403   5,609,622        Shares outstanding 36,463,346   38,782,046 Total overhang percentage 15.4%   12.6%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our burn rate and equity overhang are reasonable in relation to companies in our industry and reflect a judicious use of equity for compensation purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of January 31, 2017:

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of the principal provisions of the Amended 2010 Plan is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The summary is qualified by reference to the full text of the Amended 2010 Plan, which is included as Exhibit B to this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan has a ten-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan provides for the grant of stock options, both incentive stock options and nonqualified stock options, stock appreciation rights (SARs), restricted stock awards, restricted stock units, performance share awards, dividend equivalents, performance bonus awards and other performance-based awards to eligible individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7,050,000 shares of common stock were previously authorized for issuance pursuant to awards under the 2010 Plan and we are proposing to increase the number of shares under the Amended 2010 Plan by 1,100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares of common stock requested under the Amended 2010 Plan represents approximately 2.8% of the total outstanding shares of common stock as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 24, 2017, the closing price of our common stock on the NASDAQ Global Select Market was $736.86 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan is administered by the Compensation Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate to a committee of one or more members of the Board or one or more of our officers the authority to grant or amend awards to participants other than our senior executives who are subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act or employees who are covered employees within the meaning of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise determined by the Board, the Compensation Committee will consist solely of two or more members of the Board, each of whom is an outside director within the meaning of Section 162(m), a non-employee director as defined by Rule 16b-3 of the Exchange Act, and an independent director under the rules of the NASDAQ Stock Market (or other principal securities market on which shares of our common stock are traded).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has general authority to administer the Amended 2010 Plan, including the power to determine eligibility, the types and sizes of awards, the price and timing of awards and the acceleration or waiver of any vesting restriction, as well as the authority to delegate such administrative responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the full Board will conduct the general administration of the Amended 2010 Plan with respect to any awards to non-employee members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Persons eligible to participate in the Amended 2010 Plan include our eight non-employee members of the Board, approximately 3,755 employees of the Company and its subsidiaries and affiliates (including our executive officers), and consultants to the Company and its subsidiaries, as determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limitation on Awards and Shares Available
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of shares of common stock which may be issued or transferred pursuant to the 2010 Plan is 7,050,000 shares of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Amended 2010 Plan is approved by the stockholders, such aggregate number of shares will be 8,150,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares that are subject to awards of options or stock appreciation rights shall be counted against this limit as one (1) share for every one (1) share granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares that are subject to awards other than stock options or SARs that are settled
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in shares of common stock (Full Value Awards) shall be counted against this limit as 2.3 shares for everyone one (1) share granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares of common stock covered by the Amended 2010 Plan may be treasury shares, authorized but unissued shares, or shares purchased in the open market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that an award terminates, or expires for any reason, or an award is settled in cash without delivery of shares to the participant, then any shares subject to the award may be used again for new grants under the Amended 2010 Plan, provided, that for each share subject to a Full Value Award that so terminated, expired or settled in cash, 2.3 shares shall again become issuable under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, shares which are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) tendered by the holder or withheld by us in satisfaction of an option exercise price or tax withholding obligations with respect to any award,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) subject to a stock appreciation right that are not issued in connection with a stock settlement of such right, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) purchased on the open market with the cash proceeds from an option exercise, will not be available for grant under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Amended 2010 Plan any restricted stock repurchased by the Company at the same price paid by the participant so that such shares are returned to the Company will again be available for awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the payment of dividend equivalents in cash in conjunction with any outstanding awards will not be counted against the shares available for issuance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by applicable law or any exchange rule, shares issued in assumption of, or in substitution for, any outstanding awards of any entity acquired in any form of combination by us or any of our subsidiaries or affiliates will not be counted against shares available for issuance under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate number of shares of common stock that may be subject to one or more awards granted to any one participant pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan during any calendar year is 250,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate amount of cash that may be paid with respect to one or more awards payable in cash that may be granted to any one person pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan during any calendar year is $2,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan provides for the grant of stock options, both incentive stock options and nonqualified stock options, SARs, restricted stock awards, restricted stock units, performance share awards, dividend equivalents, performance bonus awards and other performance-based awards to eligible individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain awards under the Amended 2010 Plan may constitute or provide for a deferral of compensation, subject to Section 409A of the Code, which may impose additional requirements on the terms and conditions of such awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards under the Amended 2010 Plan are or will be set forth in award agreements, which detail the terms and conditions of the awards, including any applicable vesting and payment terms and post-termination exercise limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards other than cash awards are generally settled in shares of our common stock, but the plan administrator may provide for cash settlement of any award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No determination has been made as to the types or amounts of awards that will be granted to specific individuals pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the 2016 Summary Compensation Table and Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table in this Proxy Statement, for information on prior awards to our NEOs identified in those tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options, including incentive stock options, as defined under Section 422 of the Code, and nonqualified stock options may be granted pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option exercise price of all stock options granted pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan will not be less than 100% of the fair market value of the common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options may be exercised as determined by the Compensation Committee, but in no event may a stock option have a term extending beyond ten years after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive stock options granted to any person who owns, as of the date of grant, stock possessing more than ten percent of the total combined voting power of all classes of Company stock, however, shall have an exercise price that is not less than 110% of the fair market value of the common stock on the date of grant and may not have a term extending beyond the fifth anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate fair market value of the shares with respect to which options intended to be incentive stock options are exercisable for the first time by an employee in any calendar year may not exceed $100,000, or such other amount as the Code provides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock appreciation rights may also be granted under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock appreciation rights typically will provide for payments to the holder based upon increases in the price of our common stock over the exercise price per share, which will be no less than 100% of the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be exercised as determined by the Compensation Committee, but in no event may an SAR have a term extending beyond ten years after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon exercise of a SAR, payment may be made in cash or check or other property acceptable to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units and Performance Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock is an award of nontransferable shares of our common stock that remain forfeitable unless and until specified conditions are met, and which may be subject to a purchase price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs are contractual promises to deliver shares of our common stock in the future, which may also remain forfeitable unless and until specified conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivery of the shares underlying these awards may be deferred under the terms of the award or at the election of the participant if the plan administrator permits such a deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance shares are contractual rights to receive a number of shares of our common stock in the future based on the attainment of specified performance goals, in addition to other conditions which may apply to these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conditions applicable to restricted stock, RSUs and performance shares may be based on continuing service with us or our affiliates, the attainment of performance goals and/or such other conditions as the plan administrator may determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Bonus Awards and Other Performance-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance bonus awards are cash incentive bonuses subject to performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other performance-based awards are awards other than those enumerated in this summary that are denominated in, linked to or derived from shares of our common stock or value metrics related to our shares, and may remain forfeitable unless and until specified conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend Equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents represent the right to receive the equivalent value of dividends paid on shares of our common stock and may be granted alone or in tandem with awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents are credited as of dividend payments dates during the period between the date an award is granted and the date such award vests, is exercised, is distributed or expires, as determined by the plan administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan requires that any dividend equivalents linked to awards that are subject to performance-based vesting be subject to the same performance-based vesting conditions applicable to the underlying award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards include any of the awards that are granted subject to vesting and/or payment based on the attainment of specified performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will determine whether performance awards are intended to constitute qualified performance-based compensation, or QPBC, within the meaning of Section 162(m), in which case the applicable performance criteria will be selected from the list below in accordance with the requirements of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to constitute QPBC under Section 162(m), in addition to certain other requirements, the relevant amounts must be payable only upon the attainment of pre-established, objective performance goals set by our compensation committee and linked to stockholder- approved performance criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Amended 2010 Plan, one or more of the following performance criteria will be used in setting performance goals applicable to QPBC, and may be used in setting performance goals applicable to other performance awards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gross or net sales or revenue;  net earnings (either before or after one or more of the following: interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gross or net profit or operating margin;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cash flow (including, but not limited to, operating cash flow and free cash flow);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on capital;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on invested capital;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on stockholders equity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: multiples of price per share to earnings per share (P/E);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: price per share of common stock;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: total stockholder return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: economic value added (EVA = net operating profit after taxes - a capital charge);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: number of procedures; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employee productivity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such performance criteria may be measured either in absolute terms for us or any operating unit of our company or as compared to any incremental increase or decrease or as compared to results of a peer group or to market performance indicators or indices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan also permits the plan administrator to provide for objectively determinable adjustments to the applicable performance criteria in setting performance goals for QPBC awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will determine the methods by which payments by any award holder with respect to any awards may be paid, the form of payment, including, without limitation: (1) cash or check; (2) shares (including in the case of payment of the exercise price of an award, shares issuable pursuant to the exercise of the award) or shares held for such period of time as may be required by the Compensation Committee in order to avoid adverse accounting consequences, in each case, having a fair market value on the date of delivery equal to the aggregate payments required; or (3) other property acceptable to the Compensation Committee (including through the delivery of a notice that the award holder has placed a market sell order with a broker with respect to shares of common stock then issuable upon exercise or vesting of an award, and that the broker has been directed to pay a sufficient portion of the net proceeds of the sale to us in satisfaction of the aggregate payments required; provided that payment of such proceeds is then made to us upon settlement of such sale).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, no participant who is a member of the Board of Directors or an executive officer of the Company within the meaning of Section 13(k) of the Exchange Act will be permitted to pay the exercise price of an option in any method which would violate the prohibitions on loans made or arranged by us as set forth in Section 13(k) of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Repricing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In no case (except due to an adjustment to reflect a stock split or similar event or any repricing that may be approved by stockholders) may any adjustment be made to a stock option or a SAR award under the Amended 2010 Plan (by amendment, cancellation and re-grant, exchange or other means) that would constitute a repricing of the per-share exercise or base price of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transferability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, awards granted under the Amended 2010 Plan will not be transferable by a participant other than by will or the laws of descent and distribution or, subject to the consent of the Compensation Committee, pursuant to a domestic relations order.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, stock options and SARs will be exercisable during a participants lifetime only by him or her, unless it has been disposed of pursuant to a domestic relations order; after the death of a participant, any exercisable portion of an option or SAR may be exercised by his personal representative or by any person empowered to do so under the deceased participants will or under the then applicable laws of descent and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee has the authority to permit a participant to transfer an award other than an incentive stock option to a permitted transferee, subject to the terms and conditions in the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In no event may an award be transferable for consideration absent stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustment Provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain transactions with our stockholders not involving our receipt of consideration, such as a stock split, spin-off, stock dividend or certain recapitalizations may affect the share price of our common stock (which transactions are referred to collectively as equity restructurings).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that an equity restructuring occurs, the class, number of shares and exercise or grant price of outstanding awards will be equitably adjusted, and the plan administrator will make such further equitable adjustments as it may deem appropriate to reflect the equity restructuring with respect to the aggregate number and kind of shares that may be issued under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other types of transactions may also affect our common stock, such as a dividend or other distribution, reorganization, merger, or other changes in corporate structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that there is such a transaction, which is not an equity restructuring, and the plan administrator determines that an adjustment to the plan and any outstanding awards would be appropriate to prevent any dilution or enlargement of benefits under the Amended 2010 Plan, the plan administrator will equitably adjust the Amended 2010 Plan as to the class of shares issuable and the maximum number of shares of our stock subject to the Amended 2010 Plan, as well as the maximum number of shares that may be issued to an employee during any calendar year, and will adjust any outstanding awards as to the class, number of shares, and price per share of our stock in such manner as it may deem equitable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Certain Corporate Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Amended 2010 Plan, a change in control generally means certain transactions in which a person acquires 50% or more of our total voting power; certain changes in the composition of our Board of Directors over a two-year period; a merger or consolidation, other than a merger or consolidation which would result in our voting securities outstanding immediately prior thereto continuing to represent at least 50% of the total voting power represented by our voting securities or such surviving entitys voting securities outstanding immediately after such merger or consolidation (or the voting securities of the parent of the entity which survives such merger or consolidation); a sale or disposition of all or substantially all of our assets, other than a sale or disposition of all or substantially all of our assets to an entity, at least 80% of the combined voting power of the voting securities of which are owned by persons in substantially the same proportions as their ownership of us immediately prior to such sale; or approval by our stockholders of a plan of complete liquidation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, in its sole discretion, may adopt a change in control program to determine the vesting schedule, exercisability and other terms of outstanding awards on or after a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendment and Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee or our Board of Directors may terminate, amend, or modify the Amended 2010 Plan at any time; however, stockholder approval will be obtained for any amendment to increase the number of shares available under the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, absent stockholder approval, no option or SAR may be amended to reduce the per share exercise price of the shares subject to such option or SAR below the per share exercise price as of the date the option or SAR was granted and, except to the extent permitted by the Amended 2010 Plan in connection with certain changes in capital structure, no option, SAR, cash or other award may be granted in exchange for, or in connection with, the cancellation or surrender of an option or SAR having a higher per share exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In no event may an award be granted pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan on or after the tenth anniversary of the date the Board of Directors approved the Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a general summary under current U.S. law of the material federal income tax consequences with respect to the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amended 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary deals with the general U.S. tax principles that apply and is provided only for general information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some kinds of taxes, such as foreign, state and local income taxes, as well as gift and estate tax considerations, are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: not discussed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax laws are complex and subject to change and may vary depending on individual circumstances and from locality to locality, and the summary does not discuss all aspects of income taxation that may be relevant in light of a holders personal investment circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to nonqualified stock options, we are generally entitled to deduct, and the optionee recognizes taxable income in an amount equal to, the difference between the option exercise price and the fair market value of the shares at the time of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant receiving incentive stock options will not recognize taxable income upon grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, if applicable holding period requirements are met, the participant will not recognize taxable income at the time of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the excess of the fair market value of the common stock received over the option price is an item of tax preference income potentially subject to the alternative minimum tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If stock acquired upon exercise of an incentive stock option is held for a minimum of two years from the date of grant and one year from the date of exercise, the gain or loss (in an amount equal to the difference between the fair market value on the date of sale and the exercise price) upon disposition of the stock will be treated as a long-term capital gain or loss, and we will not be entitled to any deduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the holding period requirements are not met, the incentive stock option will be treated as one that does not meet the requirements of the Code for incentive stock options and the tax consequences described for nonqualified stock options will apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current federal income tax consequences of other awards authorized under the Amended 2010 Plan generally follow certain basic patterns: SARs are taxed and deductible in substantially the same manner as nonqualified stock options; nontransferable restricted stock subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture and restricted stock units will result in income recognition equal to the excess of the fair market value over the price paid, if any, only at the time the restrictions applicable to such awards lapse (unless, with respect to an award of restricted stock, the recipient elects to accelerate recognition as of the date of grant); stock-based performance awards, dividend equivalents and other types of awards are generally subject to tax at ordinary income rates at the time of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each of the foregoing cases, the Company will generally have a corresponding deduction at the time the participant recognizes income, subject to Section 162(m) with respect to covered employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amended 2010 Plan is designed to meet the requirements of Section 162(m) for grants of awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There can be no assurance that compensation attributable to awards granted under the Amended 2010 Plan will be treated as qualified performance- based compensation under Section 162(m) and thus be deductible to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of January 31, 2017, 4,707,218 shares subject to options awards and 737,282 RSUs had been granted pursuant to the 2010 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards, if any, to be granted to officers, employees and consultants are determined from time to time by the Compensation Committee and are not presently determinable, other than annual awards made to our directors pursuant to our non-employee director compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the date of our Annual Meeting, we expect that our non-employee directors as a group will receive an aggregate number of RSUs with an aggregate grant date fair value of $1.2 million pursuant to the Amended 2010 Plan if approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail on the compensation to our non-employee directors, please see Director Compensation above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

Meltzer, Mohr, Brogna, and Rosa were 92,475 options (10,467 RSUs); 53,800 options (6,400 RSUs); 55,300 options (7,400 RSUs); 56,400 options (8,366 RSUs); and 66,900 options (9,866 RSUs), respectively; by all current executive officers as a group was 366,100 options (51,041 RSUs); by all current directors who were not executive officers as a group was 10,000 options (9,230 RSUs); by each associate of any of such directors, executive officers or nominees was 0; by each other person who received 5 percent of such options or rights was 0; by all employees who were not executive officers as a group was 4,331,118 options (677,011 RSUs).

sentences.text: Security Holder Communication with Board Members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any holder of our securities may contact the Board of Directors or a specified individual director by writing to the attention of the Board of Directors or a specified individual director and sending such communication to our investor relations department at our executive offices as identified in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each communication from a security holder should include the following information in order to permit security holder status to be confirmed and to provide an address to forward a response if deemed appropriate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the name, mailing address and telephone number of the security holder sending the communication;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the number and type of our securities owned by such security holder; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if the security holder is not a record owner of our securities, the name of the record owner of our securities beneficially owned by the security holder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our investor relations department will forward all appropriate communications to the Board of Directors or individual members of the Board of Directors as specified in the communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our investor relations department may (but is not required to) review all correspondence addressed to the Board of Directors, or any individual member of the Board of Directors, for any inappropriate correspondence more suitably directed to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications may be deemed inappropriate for this purpose if it is reasonably apparent from the face of the correspondence that it relates principally to a customer dispute involving the purchase of goods or services from our Company or any of our operating units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
